meanings.sent1: After finishing his chores, he decided to laze on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She tends to laze around on weekends, enjoying the peaceful moments.
meanings.sent3: Instead of helping, he chose to laze in the sun, watching others work.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to laze effortlessly, embodying the art of relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The warm breeze invited him to laze by the river, forgetting all worries.

meanings.definition: To spend time in a relaxed or lazy way.
meanings.sent1: During the vacation, they would laze on the beach, soaking up the sun.
meanings.sent2: On a rainy day, she likes to laze indoors with a good book.
meanings.sent3: He would rather laze in bed than get up early for work.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to laze across the sky, moving at their own pace.
meanings.sent5: The old dog would laze in the shade, enjoying the quiet afternoon.
